channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-12073] Shell command user_permission fails on the table created by user if he is not global admin.
item.description: The command fails as the changes introduced by HBASE-10892 requires user (because of newly introduced call to getTableDescriptors) to have global admin permission.
item.summary: Shell command user_permission fails on the table created by user if he is not global admin.

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: This is not a bug as described. Descriptors are sensitive, they might contain (wrapped) data encryption keys. But maybe we should figure out how to let user_permission return something useful if the user has TABLE ADMIN? (or ADMIN on namespace)

this is a behavior change between 94-96 and 98.
from a quick look seems that getTableDescriptor takes a list of tables, and check for global-admin only if there is no list specified. maybe we can pass the regex to the server and filter there to have the table-level acl check?
Matteo Bertozzi but thats what HBASE-11452 does right?
no, the client does a listTables() to get the full list, and then the filter is done on the client

Esteban Gutierrez, Matteo is right. HBASE-11452 was to provide a java client API, and it also changed the ruby script so that the external behavior will be consistent. There was no intention to change the existing logic. Certainly, if decide to change the logic as Andrew Purtell mentioned, client code of AccessControlClient.java is a place to start with... Demai

Thanks Demai Ni and Matteo Bertozzi for the clarification. I think my misunderstanding came from the fact that I thought that in HBASE-11452 we extended getUserPermissions() in the master too to support regexes and it was not just AccessControlClient calling listTables() to get the list of tables and iterate for each table to get the permissions. IMHO the master should get the HTDs and not the client and that that might be a better solution.

IMHO the master should get the HTDs and not the client and that that might be a better solution.

Sounds reasonable.
Attaching the patch for master.

what is the rationale behind the decision of adding another method listMatchingTables() instead of using the one that we already have listTables()?
Initially, I implemented as a different method, so as not to impact other methods. Attaching a new rebased patch which doesn't involve adding new method.
Uploaded the patch to reviewboard just in case.
